message: Hi, I'm concerned about the protein content in your Premium Adult formula. My Golden Retriever Max seems less energetic lately. Can you provide detailed nutritional analysis and sourcing information for the chicken meal?

message: Luna developed severe diarrhea and dehydration after eating your Indoor Cat formula for a week. My vet suspects food intolerance. What ingredients changed in your recent reformulation?
response: Hi Lisa, I'm very sorry Luna is experiencing these symptoms. Our recent reformulation added chicory root (prebiotic) and changed from chicken fat to mixed tocopherols as preservatives. Some cats are sensitive to chicory root. Please continue following your vet's treatment plan. I'm escalating this to our quality team and arranging a full refund. We'll also send you samples of our Limited Ingredient formulas once Luna recovers. Please keep me updated on her condition.

message: What's the difference between your Indoor Formula and your Weight Management line? Cleo is an indoor cat who's gained weight recently.
response: Hi Tom, great question! Our Indoor Formula focuses on hairball control and moderate activity levels (310 kcal/cup), while Weight Management is specifically for weight loss with reduced calories (280 kcal/cup) and higher fiber to promote satiety. message: Milo has had loose stools for over a week since transitioning to your High Protein formula. I followed the transition guide exactly. What could be causing this?
response: Hi Nicole, loose stools for a week is concerning. While some dogs need longer transitions, this could indicate the high protein content (32%) is too rich for Milo's digestive system. Please gradually transition back to his previous food and consult your vet if symptoms persist. Some dogs do better with moderate protein levels (22-26%). message: Can you explain the difference between your Grain-Free and Ancient Grains lines? Tiger has been on grain-free but I'm reading conflicting information about DCM in cats.
response: Hi Alex, excellent question! DCM concerns are primarily documented in dogs, with limited evidence in cats. Our Grain-Free uses peas and potatoes as carb sources, while Ancient Grains includes quinoa, millet, and chia seeds. Both are nutritionally complete. For cats, the choice often depends on digestive sensitivity rather than DCM risk. Tiger's doing well on grain-free, so switching isn't necessary unless he shows issues. I can send you the latest veterinary research on DCM in cats if you'd like to review it.

message: Charlie has been drinking excessive water and urinating frequently since starting your Senior Dog formula 2 weeks ago. Could this be diet-related or should I see a vet?
response: Hi Karen, excessive thirst and urination are serious symptoms that require immediate veterinary attention, especially in senior dogs. While dietary changes can sometimes cause mild increases in water intake, Charlie's symptoms could indicate diabetes, kidney issues, or other serious conditions. Please see your vet immediately and mention the diet change. Discontinue the Senior formula temporarily until you get veterinary clearance. This isn't likely food-related, but your vet needs to rule out medical causes first.

message: My subscription shipment was delivered 5 days sooner than expected, but I still have food left from the previous order. Now I have excess inventory and I'm concerned about freshness. Can you change my delivery frequency?
response: Hi Frances, I apologize for the scheduling error! I've adjusted your auto-ship to deliver every 6 weeks instead of 4 weeks to prevent overstock. Your next delivery is now scheduled for August 4th. The food you received has a 12-month shelf life, so it won't expire soon, but I understand the inconvenience. I've added a 10% credit to your account for the early delivery issue. You can always adjust timing in your account portal or contact us anytime.

message: Bear has been refusing to eat and seems nauseous after trying your new Venison & Sweet Potato formula. He's lost 3 pounds in a week. This is very concerning - is there a recall?
response: Hi Chris, Bear's symptoms are very serious - 3 pounds of weight loss in a week requires immediate veterinary attention. Please stop feeding the Venison formula immediately and see your vet today. There's no current recall, but I'm escalating this to our safety team for investigation. Please bring the food packaging to your vet and keep some product for potential testing. I'm arranging a full refund and will personally follow up on Bear's condition. His health is our top priority.
